questions.clue: This type of sushi, often wrapped in seaweed, translates to 'hand roll' in English.
This vinegared rice, essential to sushi, can be combined with various ingredients like vegetables and raw fish.
Commonly used in sushi, this Japanese word refers to a spicy green paste made from horseradish.
In sushi terminology, 'neta' refers to these components placed on top of the rice, often including fish or vegetables.
This type of sushi, which means 'scattered sushi,' is known for having toppings spread over a bowl of rice.
This author of 'Crime and Punishment' also wrote 'The Brothers Karamazov'.
Known for 'Dead Souls', this writer also penned the short story 'The Overcoat'.
This Russian playwright is famous for works such as 'The Seagull' and 'Uncle Vanya'.
Author of 'Doctor Zhivago', this writer won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1958.
This 20th-century author wrote the novel 'One Day in the Life of Ivan Denisovich', depicting life in a Soviet labor camp.
This Japanese author's novel, 'Norwegian Wood', brought him international fame; he's also known for his love of music and cats.
This Russian classic by Leo Tolstoy, often considered one of the greatest novels ever written, follows the life of Anna, a socially elite woman.
Gabriel García Márquez, a Nobel laureate from Colombia, wrote this magical realism epic about the Buendía family.
This novel by Nigerian author Chinua Achebe, often read in world literature classes, depicts pre- and post-colonial life in late 19th century Nigeria.
In 'The Tale of Genji', considered the world's first novel, this Heian-era court lady illustrates the life and loves of its titular character.
This genre, originating in the African American communities of New Orleans, is known for its swing and blue notes and gave birth to styles like bebop and cool jazz.
Emerging in the 1960s, this genre blends rock and roll with elements of blues, jazz, and psychedelia, and includes bands like The Grateful Dead and Jefferson Airplane.
Originating in the late 1970s, this genre combines elements of funk, soul, and disco with spoken lyrics and was popularized by artists like Grandmaster Flash.
This genre, which arose in Jamaica in the late 1960s, is characterized by a rhythmic style with offbeat accents, and artists like Bob Marley and Peter Tosh.

Developed in the United Kingdom in the mid-1970s, this genre is a fusion of punk rock's rebellious spirit with the complexity of art rock and is exemplified by bands like The Clash and The Sex Pistols.
This invention by Johannes Gutenberg in the 15th century revolutionized the spread of literature and information.
The phonograph, patented by this famous inventor in 1877, changed the way music was consumed around the world.
This invention by George Eastman in 1888 made photography accessible to the masses, capturing everyday life in a way never before possible.
In the late 19th century, this Russian chemist developed the Periodic Table, a tool that transformed the study of chemistry.
The creation of sushi, believed to have originated in Southeast Asia before becoming popular in Japan, represents an innovative way of preserving and enjoying fish.

final.clue: This 20th-century novel, written by a Russian author, features a character named Humbert Humbert and is often praised for its lyrical prose.
